javax.microedition.location
Class LocationPermission

java.lang.Object
  java.security.Permission
      javax.microedition.location.LocationPermission
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.security.Guard
public final class LocationPermission
extends java.security.Permission

This class controls the access to the protected functionality in Location API. The following table defines the protected methods and the permission name and action parameters needed to access these methods.

name and actions parameters in LocationPermission
API call Name parameter in LocationPermission Action parameters in LocationPermission
LocationProvider.getLocation(), LocationProvider.setLocationListener(), LocationProvider.getLastKnownLocation() "location" "location"
LocationProvider.addProximityListener() "proximity_listener" "proximity"
Orientation.getOrientation() "orientation" "orientation"
LandmarkStore.getInstance(), LandmarkStore.listLandmarkStores() "landmark_store" "read"
LandmarkStore.addLandmark(), LandmarkStore.deleteLandmark(), LandmarkStore.removeLandmarkFromCategory(), LandmarkStore.updateLandmark() "landmark_store" "write"
LandmarkStore.addCategory(), LandmarkStore.deleteCategory() "landmark_store" "category"
LandmarkStore.createLandmarkStore(), LandmarkStore.deleteLandmarkStore() "landmark_store" "management"

See Also:

Constructor Detail

LocationPermission

public LocationPermission(java.lang.String name,
                          java.lang.String actions)

Creates a new LocationPermission object with the specified name and actions. The name parameter is the class to which the permissions apply. Possible name values are "location", "orientation", "proximity_listener" and "landmark_store". Parameter actions contains the desired action granted on the property. Possible action values are "location", "orientation", "proximity", "read", "write", "category" and "management". The possible combinations between names and actions is defined in the class description.

Parameters:
name - the functionality to which the permission applies
actions - the actions string
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if name or actions is null
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if actions or name is not according to table in the class description
Method Detail

implies

public boolean implies(java.security.Permission p)

Checks if this LocationPermission object "implies" the specified permission.

The method returns true if:

  • p is an instance of LocationPermission,
  • p's name is equal to the name of this object, and
  • p's actions are a proper subset of this object's actions

Specified by:
implies in class java.security.Permission
Parameters:
p - the permission to check against
Returns:
true if the specified permission is implied by this object, false if not

equals

public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)

Checks two LocationPermission objects for equality. Checks that obj is a LocationPermission and has the same name and actions as this object.

Specified by:
equals in class java.security.Permission
Parameters:
obj - the object we are testing for equality with this object
Returns:
true if obj is equal to this object, else false

hashCode

public int hashCode()

Returns the hash code value for this object.

Specified by:
hashCode in class java.security.Permission
Returns:
this object's hash code

getActions

public java.lang.String getActions()

Returns the canonical string representation of the current actions. The actions for different names are defined in the table in the class description. For the "landmark_store" name the actions must be returned in the following order: read, write, category, management.

Specified by:
getActions in class java.security.Permission
Returns:
the canonical string representation of the actions
